title: Update site-wide theme to a darker copper palette

requirements.text: Update the global Tailwind/CSS theme tokens to use a darker copper palette across the entire app (all routes/pages), by adjusting the copper-related CSS variables in `frontend/src/index.css` for both `:root` (light theme) and `.dark` (dark theme). Ensure the darker copper is reflected in primary/accent/secondary, borders/rings, and any other copper-tinted tokens so that components using `bg-primary`, `text-primary`, `border-primary/*`, gradients, and muted/accent backgrounds all shift consistently without per-page edits.

quotes: update all pages with darker copper color

acceptanceCriteria: Across all pages (Home, Ranks, Divisions, Uniform & Armor Variants, History, Photo), copper accents (primary/accent/secondary) appear noticeably darker than before and remain consistent between pages.
Light theme and dark theme both preserve readable contrast for primary buttons/links and primary-foreground text (no low-contrast copper-on-copper).
No page-specific color overrides are required to achieve the darker copper update; the change is driven by the global theme variables in `frontend/src/index.css`.

requirements.text: Update any Tailwind theme extensions that hardcode the old copper color so they match the new darker copper palette (e.g., the `shadow-copper` definition in `frontend/tailwind.config.js`) to keep shadows/embellishments aligned with the updated theme.

quotes: update all pages with darker copper color

acceptanceCriteria: Elements using `shadow-copper` (e.g., hero icons and featured cards) render with the updated darker copper tint, consistent with the new primary copper color.
No remaining hardcoded old copper values cause mismatched copper tones versus the updated CSS variable-based palette.

constraints: Do not edit files under `frontend/src/components/ui` (compose these components instead, if needed).
Do not modify immutable hook/bootstrap files listed in `frontend.immutablePaths` in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.
nonGoals: Adding new pages, routes, or features unrelated to theming.
Changing copy/content on existing pages (only color/theme adjustments).
